Your First 100 Days
To be a great delegator, you need a solid foundation. In onboarding, your EA will take over inbox, calendar, and travel. With these cornerstones in
place, you can start building toward your biggest goals together.
Goal
Kick-Off Week 0/10 Completed
Your partnership officially begins, and you start working through your first delegation playbook
Kick off your partnership and meet your EA
Complete your partnership commitment
Schedule check-ins with the Athena team
Access 1: Define your delegation stack
Before you start delegating, you need the right tools for smooth communication and task management between you and your EA.
Access 2: Align on your rituals
Regular checkoins are key in the early stages of vour pertnershio, Thate meetings let you crovkie context, offer feedback, and make sure your EA understands
Access 3: Set up your intake system
Setting up a task management system is the first move towards ensuring all your tasks are successfully delegated. You'll see what your EA is working on and
can delegate tasks smoothly on an ongoing basis.
Access 4: Share access to your inboxes
Effective delegation starts with sharing access to your tools, and the Inbox is the most critical piece of your digital infrastructure.
Access 5: Share access to your calendars
Your calendar is the blueprint of your life. To build your schedule effectively, your EA needs full visibility of your personal, professional, and family
Access 6: Set up your password manager
After giving inbox acoess, securely sharing your pesswords is the most important step toward empowering your EA to act for you. We suggest sharing
everything except bank account logins.
Access 7: Configure two-factor authentication
Setting up a system for approving two-factor authentication requests is a key step toward eliminating interruptions.
Weeks 1-2 0/3 Completed へ
Share your scheduling preferences and get help for near-term calendar roadblocks like double bookings or lack of focus time
Calendar 1: Onboard your EA into your calendar
With full access to your calendars, your EA can start freeing up your time by tackling immediate scheduling issues. This is the first move towards an optimized
calendar.
Calendar 2: Enable your EA to book meetings on your terms
For your EA to fully take on scheduling, they need to fully understand your preferences for booking both personal and professional events.
Calendar 3: Determine and protect your focus time
Scheduling focus time—dedicated hours reserved for project- or task-specific work—is an essential component of an ideal week. But not all time blocks are
equally conducive to reaching your flow state.
Weeks 3-4 0/3 Completed
Organize email workspaces and adapt to your specific email management preferences
Inbox 1: Establish your email ecosystem
Your Inbox is now calibrated to your liking. But like most early-stage delegators, you're probably still spending way too much time in there—2.6 hours per day,
on average.
Inbox 2: Identify your priority contacts
Your EA is now managing your inbox systematically. But there will always be exceptions to established processes. The next step is to set more specific
guidelines for handling your most sensitive contacts.
Inbox 3: Sweep your inbox while spending less time in it
Your Inbox is now calibrated to your liking. But like most early-stage delegators, you're probably still spending way too much time in there—2.6 hours per day,
on average.
Weeks 5-6 0 / 2 Completed
Enable stress-free meetings and create your "ideal week' as the basis for all future scheduling decisions
Calendar 4: Establish end-to-end meeting support
Meetings are more than just the time spent in a conference room. The preparation and follow-up are equally crucial. With your EA's support, you can focus on
delivering your talking points while they handle the rest.
Calendar 5: Construct your ideal week
Now that your EA is deeply ingrained in your calendar, they can help you see how it really works versus how you want it to work. And they can tweak it to
better match your priorities
Weeks 7-8 0 / 3 Completed
Facilitate hands-free email drafting by defining your writing persona and aligning on a pre-drafting syster
Inbox 4: Draft hands-free emails from anywhere
Your EA is now your always-on inbox guardian, reacting to emails with ease. The next step is shifting to proactive inbox management and deciding which
messages you want your EA to draft on your behalf.
Inbox 5: Create your EA-enabled email style guide
it usually takes time for your EA to learn how to pre-draft emalls in your voice. But with your past emalls as a guide, your EA can fast-track the learning
process and start writing like you in no time.
Inbox 6: Level up your EA's pre-drafting powers
Now that your EA has an Al-generated, personalized email style guide, they're ready to use a tool that'll help them pre-draft messages in your voice.
Weeks 9-10 0 / 2 Completed
Hand off trip planning duties and identify your preferences to ensure future travel bookings match your needs
Travel 1: Onboard your EA into your travel
Travel is extremely personal-for many Athena clients, it's the trickiest part of their life to delegate. The first step toward fully transferring your travel
preferences is getting your EA involved in your upcoming trips.
Travel 2: Detail your in-depth travel preferences
In order to confidently book travel on your terms, your EA needs to learn everything about how you like to get around.
Weeks 11-12 0 / 2 Completed
Outline your ideal flight experience and your in-depth accommodation preferences
Travel 3: Get where you're going with friction-free flights
Getting to and through the airport on the way to your destination is where your EA's pre-trip planning meets day-of execution.
Travel 4: Capture your accommodation preferences
Once your EA knows how to get you to your destination, they will develop a deeper understanding of the accommodations you prefer for different trip types.
